column2: WEST VIRGINIA DMV PERMIT PRACTICE TEST
Question Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. What should drivers do when the red lights begin to flash?
column8: Turn off the ignition.

column2: 2. This road sign is:
column8: a regulatory sign.

column2: 3. When approaching a highway-rail intersection, the first sign drivers see is usually:
column8: an RXR round sign on a yellow background.

column2: 4. The following symptoms are associated with drowsy driving:
column4: Your eyes go out of focus by themselves.
column8: You don’t remember driving the last few miles.

column2: 5. Alcohol:
column4: makes you less aware of what is happening to your driving abilities.
column8: makes it easier to make correct decisions.
column10: enhances your ability to see clearly.

column2: 6. This sign means:
column8: lane ends, merge left.

column2: 7. This road sign means:
column8: Pass with caution

column2: 8. Two drivers reach an uncontrolled intersection at the same time. Who has the right of way?
column4: The driver who does not control the car.
column8: The driver on the right.

column2: 9. Parking is not allowed:
column4: on the road side of a parked vehicle.
column8: in a crosswalk.

column2: 10. A speed limit is the __________ speed at which a vehicle may legally travel on the road under ideal conditions.
column8: maximum

column2: 11. In case of skidding, drivers should NOT:
column4: take their foot off the gas pedal.
column6: pump the brakes gently if they are about to hit something.
column8: steer the car into the direction of the skid.
column10: tap the gas pedal with their foot.

column2: 12. This road sign warns drivers that:
column6: the one-way street or roadway is about to change to two-way traffic.
column8: they are coming to a point where another traffic lane joins the one they are on.

column2: 13. It's 10 AM. This sign tells you that:
column4: you are not allowed to park here.
column6: you are allowed to park until 5:30 PM.
column8: you must park your car between 8:30 AM and 5:30 PM.
column10: you must display a special permit in order to park here.

column2: 14. This regulatory sign tells drivers that:
column4: all vehicles must turn left immediately.
column6: traffic in the right lane must go straight.
column8: traffic in the left lane must turn left at the intersection ahead.

column2: 15. When you see an emergency vehicle with flashing lights, you must:
column6: slow down and keep moving in your lane.
column8: speed up and take the nearest exit.
column10: pull to the curb and stop.

column2: 16. Which of the following must you obey over the others?
column8: A flashing red light.

column2: 17. This sign means:
column4: Parking is not allowed at 8:30 AM and at 5:30 PM
column6: You can only park between 8:30 AM and 5:30 PM.
column8: No parking between 8:30 AM and 5:30 PM.

column2: 18. This sign warns drivers that:
column4: the highway ahead is divided into two one-way roadways. Drivers should keep to the right.
column6: there is a double curve ahead.
column8: there is a low place in the road.
column10: there is a winding road ahead.

column2: 19. This road sign means:
column8: The left lane ends soon

column2: 20. Drivers who eat and drink while driving:
column8: may have trouble controlling their vehicles.

column2: 21. Who is most at risk?
column4: Drivers who are driving long distances without rest breaks.
column6: Drivers who have traditional work schedules.
column8: Drivers who have overslept.

column2: 22. When approaching a curve, remember to:
column4: drive at the posted speed limit as you enter the curve, then slow down gradually.
column6: accelerate slightly before entering the curve.
column8: slow down before entering the curve.
column10: drive at the posted speed limit throughout the curve.

column2: 23. An orange-colored sign means:
column8: Railroad crossing ahead

column2: 24. A flashing red light means:
column4: The same as a STOP sign.
column6: The light will soon change to steady red.
column8: Go, but yield the right-of-way to other traffic at the intersection.

column2: 25. If you get on a wrong expressway exit, you must:
column4: use the the exit ramp to accelerate to expressway speed and blend with traffic.
column6: make a U-turn and return to the expressway.
column8: get off at the next exit and look for signs that tell you how to return to the expressway.
column10: drive in reverse to return to the expressway.
